item.description:
Report X-2024081910

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-27
  • City: SACRAMENTO

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UNDECLARED HAZMAT PACKAGE CAME FROM UNLOAD WET AND LEAKING DILUTED SULFURIC ACID. NO MARKINGS INDICATING SHIPPING STATUS OF GOODS. LEAD ACID BATTERY LEAKED FROM LOOSE FRICTION CAPS. SPILL NEUTRALIZED AND COLLECTED WITH PHNINE AND WHISK BROOM WITH DUSTPAN. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2024081948
item.description:
Report X-2024081948

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-27
  • City: Vernon
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3800
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 8/27/2024, the BNSF Los Angeles hub personnel reported Unit ESTU 500350 (Waybill Hazardous) as leaking a substance from the middle of the container that did reach the ground after unit de ramped from a train. Unit was taken to the Hazmat Pit for safety. On the behalf of the shipper, approved contractor United Pumping was contacted and dispatched to complete inspection. Interior inspection revealed palatized cases, palletized gallon drums and 2 IBC Totes of Sulfuric Acid in 2 rows, stacked 2 high in the nose throughout the container. Source of the leak was determined to be 2 IBC Totes in the middle of the unit. The cause for the Leak was determined to be 2 IBC Totes appeared to have a pre existing creases near the top that caused the totes plastic to break, creating package failure contributing to the material leak. Total quantity of leaked liquid was approximately 10 gallons of product, 5 gallons from each IBC Tote.

item.title: Report X-2024081878
item.description:
Report X-2024081878

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-26
  • City: OAKLAND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations while unloading a bulk truck. The outer box was significantly wet and damaged. Inner contents: 4 plastic bottles x 3.785 Liters of Trans Chem Muriatic Acid. One plastic bottle leaked because of a loose/detatched top. All of the bottles had a plasitic piece of what looks like saran wrap/shrink wrap underneath the cap/top.All remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum and held pending FAA investigation. 14 unrelated packages were leaked on.

  • Description: This package was found in our unload area with no markings or indications that it had any hazardous materials inside. With further investigation and opening the box it was discovered that the box contained 3 cylinder tanks of food grade nitrous oxide. A copy of the ISF form will be attached to show how the outer packaging was found.

item.title: Report E-2024080673
item.description:
Report E-2024080673

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-26
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4250
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4ft-by-4ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that one (1) liter of material was released. Clean Harbors personnel moved all the plastic pails from the pallet to verify only two (2) were damaged, deployed oil dri, and then cleaned up the released material. The damaged pails and recovered material were placed into two (2) 55-gallon poly drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.

item.description:

  • City: SYLMAR

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: BULK PULLER NOTICED A TAINTED BOX FROM CORNER AND CALLED RESPONDER TO COME AND PICK IT UP. RESPONDER CONDUCTED A VISUAL INSPECTION, ACCORDING TO THE DECISION TREE SPECIFICATIONS, AND VERIFIED IT WAS SAFE TO TRANSPORT TO HAZMAT AREA. UPON INSPECTING THE CONTENTS, RESPONDER NOTICED DENTED PAINT CANS WITH LIQUID OOZING FROM LID OPENINGS. RESPONDER THEN FOLLOWED DISPOSAL (DMP) PROCEDURES.

item.title: Report E-2024080598

item.title: Report E-2024080572
item.description:
Report E-2024080572

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-20
  • City: LIVERMORE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 20, 2024, at 1040 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Livermore, California regarding the release of f ZEP Morado Super Cleaner 20GL. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 3 gallons of ZEP Morado Super Cleaner 20GL (UN3266, Corrosive Liquid, basic, inorganic, n.o.s., Sodium Hydroxide, 8, II) from (1) 20-gallon DF. The release was caused by a puncture and impacted a 26ft x 2ft area of the trailer floor and a 12ft x 1ft area of concrete beneath the trailer. The damaged drum of residual product was placed in a 55-gallon overpack with absorbents. Contractors then neutralized and cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF, and (1) 55-gallon DF overpack and staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.
